etymology.description: Variant form of 恤(恤) (xù, "pity") and derived from 裇(裇) (xū, "pestle") with semantic 衤(衤) (yī, "clothing") + phonetic 血(血) (xiě, "blood") -> 衤 replaced radical in 恤 -> final form 戌
etymology.interpretation: 戌(xū) is a variant form of 恤(xù, "pity") and has evolved as a replacement radical from 裇(xū, "pestle") through Cantonese phonetic derivation. It combines the element related to clothing with the phonetic element for 'blood'.

examples.chinese: 他用戌捣碎大米(他用戌搗碎大米)。
examples.english: He used a pestle to grind the rice.

examples.chinese: 妈妈把米放在大缸里(媽媽把米放在大缸裡)，用戌捣成米浆(用戌搗成米漿)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā bǎ mǐ fàng zài dà gāng lǐ, yòng xū dǎochéng mǐjiāng.
examples.english: Mom put the rice in the big jar and used a pestle to grind it into rice paste.

examples.chinese: 石磨里的戌坚固耐用(石磨裡的戌堅固耐用)。
examples.pinyin: Shímó lǐ de xū jiāngù nàiyòng.
examples.english: The pestle in the stone mill is sturdy and durable.
